name: Introduction to Biology
description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of biology, including the scientific method, cell structure and function, genetics, evolution, and ecology.

name: General Physiology
description: This course covers the fundamentals of physiology, including cells, tissues, organs, and systems. It also covers the endocrine, cardiovascular, respiratory, and digestive systems.

name: Organic Chemistry
description: This course covers the fundamentals of organic chemistry, including the structure, properties, and reactions of organic compounds.

name: Biochemistry
description: This course covers the fundamentals of biochemistry, including the structure and function of proteins, carbohydrates, lipids, and nucleic acids.

name: Advanced Physiology
description: This course covers the advanced topics in physiology, including the endocrine, cardiovascular, respiratory, and digestive systems, as well as metabolism and homeostasis.
